column4: i have a tar file, i want the files to be extracted in /, how do i run the command?
/ isnt a good place to store files for one
thanks
evolution or thunderbird to name a couple
i am using evolution, but i don't like the way it organizes mail, i just don't want "groups" of mails, but just the last one on the top
Yea, claws-mail is another one
Is nm-applet running?
have no idea, it's the default ubuntu network icon where you can see wireless, eth etc
Try alt+f2 then type nm-applet
i found that manage=false must be changed
and yes, it seems like an nm-applet
i edited th enm-system-settings.conf with managed=true but as i restart network it says WARNING: ifup -a is disabled in favour of NetworkManager.
well you want NetworkManager and nm-applet running
yes, how to remove that ifup thing
Check to see if nm-applet is running with this command: ps ax|grep nm-applet|grep -v grep
1328 ? S 0:00 nm-applet --sm-disable
ok its running so try restarting it with this: killall nm-applet; nm-applet & disown
i rebooted
Maybe you just need to add Notification Area to your panel then
reboot worked
cool
